overview.text: Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals (double damage/healing).
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed. This also applies to pets.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：暗影交织].
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.

Critical Strike: Critical Strike is very strong offensively, in addition to being a near-1:1 conversion to Parry. Its strength, relative to the rest of the stats, will depend on factors including the number of enemies hitting you, how much of their abilities can be parried, and the average amount of damage each parry-able hit does. Overall, it provides significant offensive and defensive value, and picks up even more value in M+, where the lion's share of damage is parryable. While it will not be reliable per hit, it statistically averages to a very generous amount of damage reduction, direct bonus damage from crits, indirect bonus damage from parry hasting, and significant burst-down protection in modest amounts, particularly when other additive sources of avoidance are in play ([ 符文刃舞], Night Elves, etc). However, much like other stats, it is not worth stacking.

Haste: Haste provides a 1.1% increase in rune generation per percent of haste thanks to [ 白骨之盾], and has a minor impact on the duration of your global cooldown, allowing you to cast spells slightly more frequently - the value of your self-healing is strongly dependent on the timing of your [ 灵界打击].

Mastery: [ 精通：鲜血护盾] provides a tremendous amount of value against physical damage and scales in absolute value with the amount of damage you are taking - with some severe limitations. Blood Shield's maximum value is capped at your maximum health, and as a result the value of Mastery strictly caps out defensively the moment one or two [ 灵界打击]s cause you to cap Blood Shield. Furthermore, the more damage you take (particularly if not all the damage is physical), the lower the Mastery rating required to cap out is. Every point beyond this has effectively zero value, and causes this budget to essentially be wasted. The addition of talents such as [ 钢铁之心], [ 强化灵界打击], and [ 饮血] to the mix reduce this threshold even further, making Mastery a nice-to-have but absolutely not worth stacking stat.

Versatility: Versatility provides both a reduction in damage taken and an increase in self-healing, in addition to providing a small damage increase. It is the most globally-applicable stat, but also the most expensive in terms of item value per point.

best.name: 萨莱因
priorityList: 精通 / 暴击 / 全能

best.name: 死亡使者
priorityList: 精通 / 暴击 / 全能 / 急速

overview.text: Critical Strike increases the chance of dealing critical damage with your spells. It also interacts with numerous abilities for Frost. Critical Strike directly increases how often our most crucial proc, [ 杀戮机器], occurs. It also boosts the proc rate for [ 死亡寒潮] and extends [ 冰霜之柱] through [ 漫漫严冬].

Haste increases our Rune regeneration rate, decreases the Global Cooldown, and speeds up our auto-attacks. Because the GCD decreases at the same rate as Rune regeneration increases, Haste does not reduce downtime significantly. Instead, it changes longer gaps into multiple short gaps. Haste also works alongside Critical Strike to boost [ 杀戮机器] and [ 死亡寒潮], with more chances to proc through increased attack speed.

Mastery increases the frost damage done by our abilities. This is most useful for AoE, as all of our multi-target abilities deal Frost damage. Mastery does not increase Frost damage from sources outside the spec, such as trinkets. The initial Mastery Diminishing Return kicks in at 76%.
Versatility increases damage and healing done and decreases damage taken.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals (double damage/healing).
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed. This also applies to pets.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：恐惧之刃].
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.

Critical Strike: As all abilities can crit, and this has the potential to increase our damage by a large amount. Havoc Demon Hunters have multiple Critical Strike interactions in their talents, which can shift the value of the stat heavily.

Haste: This stat increases the proc rate of nearly everything in the game, aside from traits and trinkets that provide stats on proc. It also reduces the cooldown of some of our spells, and reduces the global cooldown by up to a maximum of 100%, from 1.5 seconds down to 0.75 seconds. However, it continues to reduce other cooldowns beyond that, as well as increasing proc rates with no limit, so it does not get significantly worse at any point.

Versatility: This stat provides a general increase to damage and healing done, as well as reducing damage taken at half the same rate. It works against all forms of damage, so it is the most effective general purpose stat for damage reduction.

Mastery: This stat increases the Chaos damage we do, as well as our movement speed. The scaling is great on the stat, but the share of our damage that is affected heavily relies on talent choices and AoE vs single-target.

Agility: This is your primary stat, found on all gear except trinkets and rings, and scales extremely well with increased item level. Agility increases your Attack Power and damage done with abilities. It also increases your armor while [ 恶魔尖刺] is up, and dodge chance.
Stamina: This stat is found on every piece of gear except trinkets, and adds to your health. It is good as a baseline, but generally does not factor into consideration outside of item level.

Armor: This is also found on every piece of gear aside from rings and trinkets. It gives you physical mitigation up to a cap of 85% reduction. However, you cannot currently reach the armor cap. Every point of armor increases your effective health by the same amount, but gives less damage reduction.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals (double damage/healing).
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed. This also applies to pets.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：星界召唤].
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.

Critical Strike: Critical Strike's value on single-target is partially based on Combo Point generation from [ 撕碎]. It loses value at a fairly low amount, but will typically still be the second best stat.
Haste: Increases the tick rate of your Bleeds and increases the rate at which you generate Energy.
Mastery: Increases the damage of all Finishers and Bleeds.
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces all damage taken.

Critical Strike: Grants Dodge (subject to heavy diminishing returns), and causes your damage and healing to have a chance to critically strike, dealing double damage/healing. Guardian Druid has no notable interactions with Critical Strike. Most of Guardian’s abilities can critically hit, with the exception of [ 狂暴回复] and the extra healing produced from our Mastery ([ 精通：自然守护者]).

Haste: Haste has many effects for Guardian. Firstly, it increases melee attack speed. Secondly, it decreases the global cooldown. Thirdly, it reduces the cooldown of [ 裂伤], [[ 痛击]], and [ 狂暴回复]. Finally, it increases the tick rate of the [[ 痛击]] Bleed and [ 月火术]'s DoT component. Many of these effects increase your DPS, making Haste a valuable stat for offensive purposes. Rage generation via melee swings is also increased by Haste.

Mastery: [ 精通：自然守护者] increases maximum Health and healing received, as well as increasing Attack Power. This is a strong defensive stat, and due to the changes to ability damage scaling is also a decent offensive stat.

Versatility: Increases your damage and healing (including absorption effects), as well as reducing the damage you take. This is your strongest overall Secondary stat due to it benefitting every area of your kit. As a defensive stat it also becomes more valuable the more you have of it, due to the multiplicative nature of damage reduction effects.

Critical Strike: Provides a chance to double the healing done by your spells. Critical Strike doesn't tend to be very random for us, since we have so many healing events that it evens out over a given fight.

Haste: Decreases the cast time of our spells, adds ticks to our HoTs, and reduces the Global Cooldown (GCD). While we don't typically have many cast-time spells, the extra HoT ticks and GCD reduction are very valuable. Haste breakpoints for our HoTs still exist, but they are generally irrelevant today because when you are in-between these specific breakpoints, the HoT receives a partial tick that is added onto the regular tick. Most HoTs can be refreshed within 30% remaining of their original duration, allowing them to be extended without losing any healing. Haste also increases the number of [ 回春术]s you can have active at once, which provides extra value to extensions like [ 繁盛]. Note that we also get 6% multiplicative Haste for free and that this doesn't count toward any diminishing returns.

Mastery: [ 精通：相生] is our Mastery, awarding us additional healing on a target for each HoT we have active on them. It adds healing even when you just have one HoT on the target. We have a lot of different HoTs in our kit and thus Mastery value tends to be quite high - particularly in small group content, but in raid too. It tends to be of highest value at the peak of our ramps, which is where we do a lot of our healing.

Versatility: A flat damage and healing gain, as well as a reduction in damage taken. Versatility is generally of similar value to Critical Strike chance overall. It applies to more of our spells, but is more expensive to get 1% of.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals (double damage/healing).
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed, this stat can massively swing our mana spend in fights, especially single target.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：法力专家], this counteracts mana spend as well, the talent [ 超凡专家] also increases Master's effect for [ 奥术冲击] and [ 奥术弹幕].
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals.
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：点燃].
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals (double damage/healing).
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed. This also applies to pets.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：冰刺].
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.

Critical Strike -- 700 rating = 1% -- Thanks to [ 天神护佑] and [ 至尊之赐], Critical Strike directly increases your healing taken (while also similarly increasing all damage absorbs based on the stat), and is integral to bolstering your self-healing kit as a Brewmaster. It's also an excellent offensive stat, and frequently interacts with damage from gear effects such as trinkets.
As an Agility specialization, you automatically have 10% Critical Strike as a baseline amount.
As an Agility specialization, you automatically have 10% Critical Strike as a baseline amount.

Haste -- 660 rating = 1% -- Increases Energy regeneration and reduces the cooldowns of [[ 醉酿投]], [ 活血酒], [ 旭日东升踢], and [ 碧玉疾风] (if talented); of note, 14.3% Haste is required to reduce the cooldown of [[ 醉酿投]] to 7 seconds, and 33.4% to reduce the cooldown to 6 seconds. However, these are not meant to be "goals" due to the current complexity of the specialization and plenty of other abilities to use. Due to its limited interaction with your overall kit, Haste is frequently your least-desirable secondary, but not by a huge margin.
While Haste also normally reduces your global cooldown as well, specializations such as Brewmaster that use Energy have a 1-second global cooldown at all times.
While Haste also normally reduces your global cooldown as well, specializations such as Brewmaster that use Energy have a 1-second global cooldown at all times.

Mastery -- 700 rating = 1 Mastery Point (What's this?) -- Your [ 精通：醉拳大师] functions more or less like Dodge chance. It is a decent, reliable offensive boost as well, though it has some major shortcomings that may make it a second-tier stat option. First, [ 幻灭踢] can frequently push you over 100% Dodge, resulting in wasted avoidance. Second, and more importantly, it does nothing to reduce damage that cannot be dodged. Finally, as the stat increases your Attack Power, it does not increase the damage of gear effects such as trinkets, which are frequently a large portion of your damage dealt as a tank. Despite these limitations, it is the strongest effective damage reduction stat against anything that can be dodged, and still effective for increasing the damage of your abilities.
Brewmaster Monks start with a Mastery of 7% Dodge chance per stack, and an Attack Power increase of 8%.
Brewmaster Monks start with a Mastery of 7% Dodge chance per stack, and an Attack Power increase of 8%.

Versatility -- 780 rating = 1% -- While it is an excellent stat for both increasing your damage and healing while also providing passive damage reduction, Versatility is also a stat that you will require more of to reach similar percentages. It is a particularly strong choice due to additionally increasing the damage of effects outside of your own abilities, such as trinkets.

best.name: 影踪派
priorityList: 全能 = 暴击 = 精通

best.name: 祥和宗师
priorityList: 全能 = 暴击 = 精通

overview.text: Critical Strike - This is a percent chance that abilities will critically strike, increasing the potency of them by at least twice their expected amount. There are a few effects (like the Dwarven racial ability [ 山丘之力]) that further increase the potency of your critical strikes.

Haste - Things speed up. Spell cast times are faster, the global cooldown becomes shorter, Haste-flagged cooldowns (like [ 旭日东升踢] and [ 幻灭踢]) are quicker to cooldown, and the time between our healing events from [[[ 复苏之雾]]] and [ 氤氲之雾] is quicker.
Because of their static durations, when there is time between when one of these effects are expected to fall off and the time it has been since its previous tick, a partial tick, relative to how close it was to its next full tick, heals your ally as it fades. That is to say, if your [[[ 复苏之雾]]] got 75% of the way to another tick, but the duration caused it to fade, your target is healed by [[[ 复苏之雾]]] for 75% of the amount of the other "full" ticks healed for.

Because of their static durations, when there is time between when one of these effects are expected to fall off and the time it has been since its previous tick, a partial tick, relative to how close it was to its next full tick, heals your ally as it fades. That is to say, if your [[ 复苏之雾]] got 75% of the way to another tick, but the duration caused it to fade, your target is healed by [[ 复苏之雾]] for 75% of the amount of the other "full" ticks healed for.

Mastery - Each specialization has a different mastery, unique to themselves. For Mistweavers, our Mastery is [ 精通：迷雾之风]. When we heal an ally with a targeted spell, they receive another healing event, its Spell power is based on our Mastery rating. Because it's another healing event, its affected by Versatility, and it can critically strike, making it so that those two stats can increase the throughput of its healing even when you have low Mastery rating.

Versatility - An extremely simple stat, this is a flat increase to all damage and healing done, while also passively reducing incoming damage taken, at a rate double that of the throughput increase (e.g., a 10% increase to damage and healing results in a 5% reduction in damage).

best.name: Conduit of the Celestials Raid Stat Priority
Master of Harmony Raid Stat Priority

overview.text: Critical Strike: Increases the chance that abilities deal 100% increased damage. Bounces around with Versatility due to differing availabilities.
Haste: Increases energy regeneration, reduces cooldown of [ 怒雷破], [ 旭日东升踢], and [ 升龙霸]. After the changes made for the start of The War Within, this is a very strong secondary stat.
Mastery: Increases the damage of abilities, provided they are not a repeat of the previous cast. After the changes made for 11.1, this is a very strong secondary stat.
Versatility: Increases all damage dealt, healing done, and reduces damage taken. Generally a desirable stat, largely due to limited availability.
Critical Strike: Chance for each attack and ability to do twice as much damage or healing, and helps proc [ 圣光灌注].
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed. Also reduces the global cooldown, and the cooldowns of some spells like [ 神圣震击].
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：光明使者]. This increases the healing you do based on how close your target is to you or your Beacon targets.
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.
Strength gives parry chance against melee swings, increases the armor gain of [ Shield of the Righteous], and attack power, which scales the power of abilities.
Armor reduces the damage you take from most physical non-bleed damage sources. Protection Paladin has several armor multipliers that make armor from gear more effective.
Stamina increases your raw health pool.
Block reduces the damage you take from attacks that you rolled a block event on. The only place to find this stat is the Shield slot.
Secondary stats - most items have two secondary stats but there are exceptions.

Critical Strike: Increases the chance to deal extra damage and healing done by virtually all abilities, including your own spells, auto attacks, trinkets, and many other effects. Gains value with talents like [ 裁定] and [ 十字军之心].

Haste: Compresses the rotation by reducing both the GCD and the cooldown of the rotational abilities like [ 十字军打击], [ 审判], [ 公正之剑], and [ 愤怒之锤]. Important for damage, but can be overrated due to it feeling more impactful than it sometimes is.

Mastery: [ 精通：大领主的审判] increases Holy damage done, which essentially buffs all of Retribution's natural damage. It also gives [ 审判] a chance to deal extra Holy damage when cast. Mastery affects all baseline spells and talents, but won't apply to racial abilities like [ 圣光裁决者] or other outside sources of Holy damage.

Versatility: Increases damage done and reduces damage taken by half the amount. Although it's not a very exciting stat compared to the others, it will often be more valuable than it initially appears thanks to its damage reduction component.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks (double damage), and generates extra  连击点数 through [ 封印命运]
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed. This additionally increases the speed at which damage over time effects tick.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：强效奇袭], increasing a large portion of our damage.
Versatility: Increases all damage, and reduces all damage taken.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals (double damage/healing).
Haste: Increases attack speed, energy regen, and the GCD reduction effect of [ 冲动].
Mastery: Increases the damage of [ 精通：左右开弓].
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.
Versatility: Increases all damage done and reduces damage taken.
Mastery: Increases the damage of your finishers.
Critical Strike: Chance to deal double damage with your attacks.
Haste: Increases attack speed, energy regeneration, and [ 割裂] tick rate.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals (usually about triple the original value for us).
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed. This also applies to pets.

Mastery: Increases all Elemental and Physical damage. Your [ 闪电箭], [ 熔岩爆裂], [ 闪电链], [ 冰怒], and, if talented into [ 山峦将倾], [ 大地震击], [ 元素冲击], and [ 地震术] casts have a chance to trigger a second cast on the same target, dealing significantly less damage and generating less Maelstrom.
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.
Critical Strike: Chance for attacks and heals to deal double damage.
Haste: Increases attack speed, and reduces the cooldown and Global Cooldown of most of your rotational abilities.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：增强元素], increasing your Fire, Frost and Nature damage dealt and the chance for [ 风怒武器] and [ 风暴喷涌] to activate.
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals (double damage/healing).
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed. This also applies to pets.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：深度治疗].
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals.
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed.
Mastery: Increases the damage done by your DOT and other Affliction based effects by %.
Versatility: Increases damage and reduces damage taken by half.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals.
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed.
Mastery: Increases the damage done by your demons by %.
Versatility: Increases damage and reduces damage taken by half.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals.
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed.
Mastery: Your spells deal additional damage, up to X%.
Versatility: Versatility: Increases damage and reduces damage taken by half.

Strength: Increases all damage done by native class spells, abilities, and auto attacks. Previously one of the weakest stats, but now much more impactful, making raw item level much more important again.
Critical Strike: Increases auto-attack rage generation, as well as damage done by abilities, auto attacks, and trinkets. It is the most important stat for reducing downtime in the rotation.

Haste: Compresses the rotation by reducing the GCD and the cooldown of the rotational abilities Mortal Strike, Skullsplitter, and Cleave. The stats value frequently fluctuates with that of Critical Strike.
Mastery: Increases the damage to targets affected by Deep Wounds. It does not affect outside sources of damage such as trinkets, potions, or enchantments.
Versatility: Increases damage and reduces damage taken by half. Unlike Mastery, however, it affects all damage done including trinkets, potions, and enchantments.

Strength: Increases all damage done by native class spells, abilities, and auto attacks. Previously one of the weakest stats, but now much more impactful, making raw item level much more important again.

Haste: Compresses the rotation by reducing both the GCD and the cooldown of the rotational abilities Bloodthirst, Raging Blow, and Execute. Often a priority for very early gearing in The War Within, it tends to fall in value fairly quickly.

Critical Strike: Increases damage done by abilities, auto attacks, and trinkets. While some talents, legendaries, and covenant abilities interact with critical strikes, the stat's value is rather low and better avoided.
Mastery: Increases the damage bonus of Enrage. It does not affect non-class damage, such as trinkets, potions, and enchantments.
Versatility: Increases damage done and reduces damage taken by half the amount. Unlike Mastery, however, it affects all damage done including trinkets, potions, and enchantments.
Haste reduces the global cooldown, which increases Rage generation, DPS, and damage reduction with [ 无视苦痛]. It also increases the availability of [ 盾牌格挡]. It is the best secondary stat, hands-down.
#1 stat overall.
Versatility is a plain increase in damage done and damage reduction. It increases Equipment damage such as Trinkets or special weapons as well! A good stat all around.

Critical Strike is a great DPS stat. In M+ specifically, it gets a lot of traction defensively because of the sheer amount of melee attacks being thrown at you, and often times can parry dangerous tank busters or prevent certain debuff applications entirely. You should however not plan around this happening. As only a fool relies on chance.

Mastery increases both the chance to critically block and base block chance. This increases overall damage mitigation. The main shortcoming is that it doesn't directly improve your damage reduction against unblockable sources (such as spell damage or DoTs/Bleeds) -- although it does increase your Attack Power, which makes [ 无视苦痛] stronger.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：巨人杀手].
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed.
Critical Strike: Provides a chance for your attacks and heals to be more effective.
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.

Critical Strike: Provides a chance to double the healing done by your spells. We have a few special Critical Strike interactions in [ 振奋迸发] (which makes our critical heals bigger when active), and [ 逆转] which lasts longer the more Critical Strike we have. Critical Strike notably does not increase the healing done by our absorption shields like [ 时空畸体], which is going to hurt it in our stat rankings a little bit. It also doesn't affect some other abilities like [ 翡翠交融], as well as some item effects.

Haste: Decreases the cast time of our spells (including Empowered spells), adds ticks to our HoTs (namely [ 梦境吐息] and [[ 逆转]]), and reduces our Global Cooldown (GCD). Haste also reduces the cooldown of some of our spells, such as [ 焚身], [[ 逆转]], [ 时空畸体], and [ 青翠之拥]. Haste is a fiddly enough stat for Preservation that it gets its own paragraph below.

Mastery: [ 精通：生命的缚誓者] increases our healing if our Health percentage is higher than that of our target. This is a pass/fail mechanic, meaning that if you're at equal or higher Health you'll get full Mastery value. Our Mastery is extremely good, and in raid you will actively seek it out. It's our strongest Secondary stat by quite a large margin due to it being significantly cheaper per point than the alternatives.
Versatility: Adds damage, healing, and a reduction in damage taken, but is more expensive as a result. The upside is that it affects more of our abilities than Critical Strike or even Mastery do.

Critical Strike: Provides a chance to double the damage done by your spells. Critical Strike has one additional interaction for Augmentation through the passive ability [ 时间之沙], which causes certain spells to extend the remaining duration of [[ 黑檀之力]]. This effect also has a chance to critically strike, increasing the [[ 黑檀之力]] extension granted by an additional 50%.

Haste: Decreases the cast time of your spells (including Empowered spells), adds ticks to our DoT effects (such as [ 火焰吐息]), and reduces the Global Cooldown (GCD). These effects have a modest effect on your ability to extend [[ 黑檀之力]], mainly through being able to occasionally fit additional casts of [ 喷发] inside the [[ 黑檀之力]] window.

Mastery: [ 精通：时光旅行者] has two powerful effects: It increases the amount of Versatility granted to nearby allies through [ 变换流沙], and also extends the base duration of all Augmentation buffs and helpful auras. While not quite as potent as Intellect point for point, these two effects are particularly potent in group play, and are the reason that Mastery is considerably more valuable than any of the other Secondary stats for Augmentation.

Versatility: Adds damage, healing, and a modest reduction to damage taken, but is a relatively more expensive stat than the others as a result. Versatility has no appreciable impact to Augmentation's ability to buff other players, and is entirely limited to your own personal damage output. As a result, it is by far the weakest Secondary stat for Augmentation Evoker aiming to optimize performance in group play.
Agility is your Primary stat. Agility increases your Attack Power and damage done on abilities.

Weapon DPS increases the damage done by your weapon and abilities that scale off weapon damage, which will be most of your abilities. This stat will generally mean that increasing the item level of your weapon is highly impactful.
Critical Strike: Chance for extra effectiveness on attacks and heals (double damage/healing).
Haste: Increases attack speed and spell casting speed. This also applies to pets.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：狙击训练].
Versatility: Increases damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.
Critical Strike: Grants a chance for extra effectiveness on attacks. Has bonus synergy with talents such as [ 锯齿尖锋], [ 外域之毒], and [ 侧翼优势].
Haste: Increases attack speed, lowers the Global Cooldown (GCD), and reduces the cooldown on certain abilities such as [ 杀戮命令] and [ 野火炸弹]. The increased attack speed also applies to pets.

Mastery: Increases the damage bonus of [[ 精通：灵魂联结]]. Despite the tooltip of [[ 精通：灵魂联结]] implying all damage, it only affects damage dealt from Hunter sources. Trinkets and other special effects are not counted.
Versatility: Increases all damage and healing, and reduces damage taken.
Critical Strike: Provides a chance to double the damage and healing done by your spells. Overall very solid stat.

Haste: Haste reduces the cooldown of certain spells like [ 心灵震爆], which can greatly improve our efficiency, and also other damage and healing spells, which results in greater throughput. More rapid casts allow for more Atonements to be placed out for specific windows of damage.

Mastery: [ 精通：优雅] increases all healing and absorbs on targets with Atonement. Once you have a suitable amount of Haste, you will look towards high ilvl gear with both Mastery and Critical Strike on them. If you are more focused on Mythic+/5mans, you may look for stats that will increase your damage instead of Mastery.
Versatility: Provides a linear gain in outgoing healing and damage, as well as reduction of damage taken. Versatility does NOT double dip with [ 救赎] healing. Only the healing portion affects it.

Critical Strike: Provides a chance to double the healing done of your spells. This synergizes quite well with Mastery and the bigger focus on a direct healing playstyle through heavy Holy Word usage in that Critical direct heals also increases the size of the [ 圣光回响] heal that follows them. While it is random, which is a drawback for many healers, it is rare to find many of your heals relying on a critical strike at a specific moment to save a player from death; often proper preparation is the key to saving lives. Next in priority in raid healing after Mastery.

Haste: Haste decreases the cast time of your spells and also adds ticks during the healing over time of [[ 恢复]]. While Haste breakpoints still exist for [[ 恢复]], they are irrelevant today because when you are in between these breakpoints the HoT receives partial ticks that are added onto the regular tick. Haste also reduces the Global Cooldown (GCD) and the cooldowns of certain spells like [ 愈合祷言] and others that have a green text when you mouseover their tooltips in game. More often, taking higher ilvl items will give you sufficient Haste to get into a comfortable flow of responding to damage.
Mastery: Increases the effectiveness of [ 精通：圣光回响], leaving HoTs on the targets from our direct heals.
Versatility: Provides a linear gain in outgoing healing and damage, as well as a reduction in damage taken.
